intro: Stenogyne decumbens, commonly known as the decumbent pohuehue, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its sprawling growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
